Description
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.
American Express is on a journey to provide the world’s best customer experience every day.
The successful candidate will be responsible to drive customer engagement and business growth by developing and executing digital adaption strategies as a part of the Global Commercial Services (GCS) organization.
The candidate will be located in Tokyo, working closely with the Global platform owners and Sales and Marketing teams to provide superiour Digital Experience to our Corporate Card Clients in Japan.
The Digital Experience Manager will be responsible for defining and delivering a unified & innovative Employee Card Management experience for our Corporate Card clients through our @ Work platform.

Directly reporting to Business Development Director in Japan and dotted lines to Central Teams to develop, align, execute and track digital experience of our Corporate Clients.
Coordinate with Sales to drive adoption for @ WORK with the key focus on Global Apply for Card.

End-to-End local ownership of @ Work including;
1) Developing market digitalization strategy
2) Alignment between various internal stakeholders to ensure accurate communication to external Clients.
3) Trainings and Sell In to Clients (including inquiry handling)
4) Collateral review and translation support (English to Japanese)
5) Issue management (including UAT and verification)
6) Consolidation of future enhancement requests
Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
Qualifications
1) Experience in Digital Product Management, Servicing or Communications
2) Customer centric mind-set.
3) Ability to build relationships and influence broadly across organizations and collaborate on problems with multiple stakeholders.
4) Results-driven mindset with the ability to work under pressure, navigate through ambiguity, and balance multiple priorities in a matrixed Corporate environment
5) Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Japanese with the ability to influence external clients and internal senior leaders.
6) Demonstrated ability to conceptualize and deliver new platform capabilities, participate in defining specifications, collaborate within and across teams on design and delivery, manage project and be able to interpret results.
7) Bachelor’s degree required, master’s degree preferred
8) 5+ years of professional experience in product management or strategy in Financial Services preferred
